intro: Erigeron pinnatus, commonly known as the slender fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and prairies, often in disturbed soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, while its flowers are white to pale blue, with prominent yellow centers. Erigeron pinnatus is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in diverse environmental conditions.
